name: Turkey Meatballs
description: Italian herb and parmesan turkey meatballs, baked to perfection. Low-fat, high-protein, and incredibly juicy.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Grate zucchini and transfer to clean kitchen towel. Squeeze firmly to remove excess moisture.
instructions.tip: Wet zucchini makes meatballs too soft and they fall apart.

instructions.instruction: Grate onion and squeeze out liquid similarly. Or blend onion and garlic together.
instructions.tip: Blended onion distributes evenly and adds moisture.

instructions.instruction: Place ground turkey in large mixing bowl.
Add panko, parmesan, onion-garlic mixture, and squeezed zucchini.
Add all seasonings and chopped parsley.
Mix gently with hands until just combined. DO NOT OVERMIX - makes tough meatballs.
instructions.tip: Mix only until ingredients are combined, don't knead.

instructions.instruction: Wet hands slightly. Roll into golf ball-sized meatballs (about 1 inch diameter).
instructions.tip: Uniform size = even cooking. Use ice cream scoop for consistency.

instructions.instruction: Place meatballs on prepared sheet with 2cm space between each.

instructions.tip: Oil helps exterior brown and develop nice color.
Internal temperature should reach 165°F - use meat thermometer.

instructions.instruction: Remove golden, cooked meatballs from oven. Rest 3 minutes.
Serve with marinara sauce, yogurt sauce, or tzatziki.

tips: Ground turkey has 40% less fat than ground beef.
Zucchini acts as moisturizer since lean meat tends to dry out.
Meatballs can be shaped ahead and refrigerated for a day.
Freeze raw or cooked for up to 3 months.
Baking uses far less oil than pan-frying.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 4 days, freeze 3 months. Reheat in sauce to prevent drying.
servingSuggestion: Serve with marinara sauce and spaghetti Italian-style, or with pita and tzatziki Mediterranean-style.
variations: Feta stuffed: Hide feta cheese cubes inside.
Asian style: Add ginger, soy sauce, and sesame.
Mexican: Add cumin, cilantro, and jalapeño.
